Follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter and visit nyucareers.com .     Your Benefits                  Employee Benefits Read More                 Faculty Benefits Read More          NYU is proud of the opportunities and advantages it offers to faculty and employees, and holds a long-standing commitment to provide high-quality benefits and programs that meet the needs of our diverse community. To download benefits forms , click here . To access the Benefits Resource Center , click here . For benefits questions , contact a PeopleLink representative. Read More                                                              May LiveSmart Supporting your healthy habits and fiscal fitness                     Why Weight? Meet NYU Lose Smart's weight loss champions                     NYU's Fabulous 5 Join us in congratulating amazing administrators                     A Terrific Team Redefining Sexual Respect at NYU                     Above and Beyond 12 deserving employees earn Give-A-Violet award         NYU HR   Our Mission & Values   Create a work environment and build a workforce that elevates the University and enables all who research, teach, and work at NYU to achieve more than they can at any other university.                                                  Integrity                               Uphold superior ethical standards by promoting accountability, fairness, honor, transparency, and trust.                                                                Respect for the Individual                               Interact with all persons openly, equally, and fairly with dignity and with consideration for individual differences. Recognize multiple valid perspectives. Assume positive intent. Commit to honest self-evaluation. Communicate with transparency and empathy.                                                                Service Excellence                               Serve internal and external customers accurately, competently, efficiently, and in a timely manner. Anticipate needs. Seek to provide complete solutions that extend beyond the customer’s stated request. Communicate with transparency and empathy.                                                                Continuous Improvement                               Challenge the status quo. Collectively and as individuals seek to innovate, learn, and improve our services, processes, practices, and knowledge. Assess and evaluate our progress. Take informed risks.                                                                Partnership                               Collaborate and communicate. Respect, recognize, and leverage the knowledge and strengths of others. Operate and communicate with an enterprise-wide view, regardless of functional reporting relationships. Understand, anticipate, respond to, and support the professional and personal needs of our stakeholders. Promote community and collegiality. Integrity                               Uphold superior ethical standards by promoting accountability, fairness, honor, transparency, and trust.                                                                Respect for the Individual                               Interact with all persons openly, equally, and fairly with dignity and with consideration for individual differences. Recognize multiple valid perspectives. Assume positive intent. Commit to honest self-evaluation. Communicate with transparency and empathy.                                                                Service Excellence                               Serve internal and external customers accurately, competently, efficiently, and in a timely manner. Anticipate needs. Seek to provide complete solutions that extend beyond the customer’s stated request. Communicate with transparency and empathy.                                                                Continuous Improvement                               Challenge the status quo. Collectively and as individuals seek to innovate, learn, and improve our services, processes, practices, and knowledge. Assess and evaluate our progress. Take informed risks.                                                                Partnership                               Collaborate and communicate. Respect, recognize, and leverage the knowledge and strengths of others. Operate and communicate with an enterprise-wide view, regardless of functional reporting relationships. Understand, anticipate, respond to, and support the professional and personal needs of our stakeholders. Promote community and collegiality. Over a Terabyte (or roughly 1 trillion bytes) of data      traverse NYU-NET every day!                                         Connect to NYU-NET & the Internet   Connect Your Mobile Device   Connect to NYU Web   Connect to NYUHome   Connect to NYU Libraries Resources        Connect to NYU-NET & the Internet     NYU-NET is NYU's campus-wide, Internet-connected network of computers, computer-related equipment,  and information resources. It is used by University students, faculty, administrators, and staff.  Underlying NYU-NET is a collection of hardware, software, operating procedures, and policies that  define and manage how NYU-based computers connect to each other and to the Internet.    There are a variety of ways to connect to NYU-NET whether you are on-campus or off-campus .  Explore the navigation menu to the left for more information and instructions. ITS also  provides software that will help you protect the security of your  computer and data, and make the most of your NYU-NET connection.    Your NYU NetID and password are your key to most authenticated NYU-NET resources.     Connect Your Mobile Device   Instructions on how to configure a mobile device to access your NYU E-mail, Calendar, and other Google Apps for Education are available at www.nyu.edu/its/google/ .  Note that you will need to set a separate Google Apps password at start.nyu.edu , which is different from your NYUHome password, in order to connect.    Instructions on how to set up an NYU-provided mobile device (e.g., Blackberry, iPhone) are available at www.nyu.edu/its/mobile/setup/ .      Connect to NYU Web   To access NYU Web, the main NYU website, visit http://www.nyu.edu/ .        Connect to NYUHome   NYUHome ( http://home.nyu.edu/ ) is an online service that provides information  and facilitates collaboration, interaction and communication for all NYU students, faculty and staff.  It is a portal to many web-based services and tools. All NYU community members with access to NYUHome  use their NYU NetID and password to log in. For more information and activation  instructions, see the NYUHome Help pages .      Connect to NYU Libraries Resources    Some NYU Libraries resources can be accessed through the Research Tab in   NYUHome . Some online Libraries resources require a  specific proxy configuration, so the subscription resources that NYU makes available to students,  faculty, and staff recognize that you are a part of the NYU community. For more information on  which Libraries resources require NYU-NET Proxy, and instructions on how to  configure proxy settings for your computer, see the NYU-NET Proxy page  of this website.    Page last reviewed: June 1, 2012

                     Locations & Facilities                                                                         Home           //        Help & Support                 //        Ask ITS                 //         IT Service Desk                                      IT Service Desk                                                 search the site                                                                        IT Service Desk   24 hours a day, 7 days a week     In NYC: 1-212-998-3333  AskITS@nyu.edu   Contact form   ServiceLink         In-person help in NYC   10 Astor Place, 4th Floor  9:00am-6:00pm, Mon-Fri       Global locations  See the "How to get help" section to the left for local Service Desk information.          related pages            NYURoam Wireless       NYU Classes       NYU Google Apps (Email, Calendar & more)       NYU ResNet       NYU Print Service       NYUHome Help       ITS Training & Workshops       IT Service Status                     The IT Service Desk is the first point of contact for technology services and help from Information Technology Services; see below for contact details.   For self-service support and request forms for services provided by ITS and an ever-expanding number of other NYU-provided services, explore NYU ServiceLink .       New York, Accra, Madrid & Tel Aviv   NYU community members in New York, Accra, Madrid, and  Tel Aviv can contact the IT Service Desk in a number of ways:    For help by telephone , call 1-212-998-3333 to speak with IT Service Desk staff 24 hours a day, seven days a week. (NYU-NY community members can simply call 8-3333 from on-campus phones.)    For help online , submit your question (including as many details as possible) using the contact form or by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu . A representative will respond to the email address you supply within one business day.    For in-person help in New York , visit the IT Service Desk at 10 Astor Place, 4th floor, from Monday through Friday, 9am to 6pm ET. For help with configuring your laptop computer, however, call 1-212-998-3333 first to make an appointment.     Abu Dhabi   NYU community members at NYU Abu Dhabi can contact the IT Service Desk 24 hours a day, seven days a week by sending email to nyuad.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 971-2-628-8888 (or simply 8-8888 from on-campus phones).   NYU Abu Dhabi Campus Technology Center walk-in hours on the 3rd floor of the Library are: Sunday-Thursday, 8am-7pm GST; Friday: closed; Saturday: 12pm-7pm GST.   Berlin   NYU community members at NYU Berlin can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 49-30-290291-333 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones).   Buenos Aires   NYU community members at NYU Buenos Aires can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 4828-5233 (or simply 833 from on-campus phones).   Florence   NYU community members at NYU Florence can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 39-055-5007-777 (or simply 0-7777 from on-campus phones).   London   NYU community members at NYU London can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to nyul.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 44-20-79073-333 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones). NYU London IT Service Desk hours are Monday through Thursday, 8am to midnight GMT; Friday, 1pm to midnight GMT; and Saturday & Sunday, 5pm to midnight GMT.   Paris   NYU community members at NYU Paris can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 01-53-73-28-33 (or 3-2833 from on-campus phones).   Prague   NYU community members at NYU Prague can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 224-240-882.   Shanghai   NYU community members at NYU Shanghai can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to shanghai.it.help@nyu.edu or by calling 9-5555 (from on-campus phones) or 86-21-20595555 (from off-campus phones).   Singapore   NYU community members at Tisch Asia (Singapore) can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 800-181-1101 (or simply 333 from on-campus phones).   Sydney   NYU community members at NYU Sydney can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 61-2-8016-8233 (or 6-8233 from on-campus phones).   Washington, DC   NYU community members at NYU Washington, DC can contact the IT Service Desk by sending email to AskITS@nyu.edu or by calling 202-654-8333 (or 504-8333 from on-campus phones).
